intro: Koanophyllon bullescens, commonly known as the balloonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, balloon-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Koanophyllon bullescens typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a distinctive species within its native habitat.
